intro: Columnea ecuadorana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped, glossy leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Columnea ecuadorana is valued in horticulture for its unique floral display and ability to thrive in well-drained, nutrient-rich soil.
